t: Psalm 59
Deliver Me from My Enemies
To the choirmaster: according to Do Not Destroy. A Miktam of David, when Saul sent men to watch his house in order to kill him.
Deliver*pn me from my enemies, O my God; protect*ld me from those who rise up against me;
deliver*ln me from those who work evil, and*ld save me from bloodthirsty men.
For*pn behold, they lie in wait for my life; fierce*ld men stir up strife against me. For*ln no transgression or sin of mine, O Lord,*s
for*ld no fault of mine, they run and make ready. Awake,*ln come to meet me, and see!
You,*ld Lord*s God of hosts, are God of Israel. Rouse*ln yourself to punish all the nations; spare*ld none of those who treacherously plot evil. Selah*ig
Each*pn evening they come back, howling*ld like dogs and*ld prowling about the city.
There*ln they are, bellowing with their mouths with*ld swords in their lips— for*ld “Who,” they think, “will hear us?”
But*pn you, O Lord,*s laugh at them; you*ld hold all the nations in derision.
O*ln my Strength, I will watch for you, for*ld you, O God, are my fortress.
My*ln God in his steadfast love will meet me; God*ld will let me look in triumph on my enemies.
Kill*pn them not, lest my people forget; make*ld them totter by your power and bring them down, O*ld Lord, our shield!
For*ln the sin of their mouths, the words of their lips, let*ld them be trapped in their pride. For*ln the cursing and lies that they utter,
consume*ld them in wrath; consume*ld them till they are no more, that*ln they may know that God rules over Jacob to*ld the ends of the earth. Selah*ig
Each*pn evening they come back, howling*ld like dogs and*ld prowling about the city.
They*ln wander about for food and*ld growl if they do not get their fill.
But*pn I will sing of your strength; I*ld will sing aloud of your steadfast love in the morning. For*ln you have been to me a fortress and*ld a refuge in the day of my distress.
O*ln my Strength, I will sing praises to you, for*ld you, O God, are my fortress, the*ld God who shows me steadfast love.
